results.title: Domestic Play (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ann Sharp, Kathleen Manning, Drake Educational Associates and Video Lock Educational
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Structuring Play in the Infant School No.2”.
Identifies the different kinds of teacher involvement in domestic play. Domestic play includes mothers and fathers, dolls, shopping, cooking, cleaning, washing, furnishing the house, and hospitals

results.title: Play with Natural Materials (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Structuring Play in the Infant School No.5”.
Children’s play with natural materials appears to be divided into sensory, imaginative and exploratory play. Shows teachers harnessing the fascination that natural materials have for young children

results.title: Make Believe Play (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Structuring Play in the Infant School Series No.4”.
Shows children’s play with paint, crayons, scrap, collage and dressing-up materials, that involves children in making and pretending. It shows the development from spontaneous play to a structured play situation

results.title: Construction Play (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ann Sharp, Kathleen Manning, Drake Educational Associates and Ward Lock Educational
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Structuring Play in the Infant School No.3”.
Shows the different kinds of stimuli that are the basis of the children’s play. Construction play covers play with large and small building material both manufactured and improvised; sometimes these are combined with other materials e.g. sand

results.title: Entropy
results.creator_credit: David Jackson, Open University and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Structure, bonding and the periodic law”
Professor L.J. Haynes and Dr R.A. Ross, assisted by Mr R. Andon of the National Physical Laboratory discuss experiments relating to the transfer of energy, illustrating the laws of thermodynamics and the concept of entropy.

group.title: Structure Bonding and the Periodic Law

results.title: Enthalpy (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Structure Bonding and the Periodic Law”.
Professor Haynes of Open University explains the procedures involved in the National Physical Laboratory’s equipment to determine enthalpy changes. The process is compared to home/school laboratory calorimeters and used to discuss the theory of and problems associated with measuring energy changes in chemical reactions.

results.title: Grain structure
results.creator_credit: Robin Cantelon, Frank A. Hoare and Merton Park
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Structure and Properties of Steel”.
Explains how grain structure and grain size in steel are affected by its carbon content the way in which it is worked and its heat treatment. Indicates also how properties of hardness, ductility and tensile strength are due to differences in its internal structure.

results.title: Carbon content
results.creator_credit: Robin Cantelon, Frank A. Hoare and British Iron and Steel Federation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Structure and Properties of Steel”.
In steel, carbon exists as a chemical compound with iron, known as cementite. The distribution of cementite and ferrite, or pure iron, governs grain structure. The film shows how this distribution is affected when the steel is heated and cooled
